statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Colorado 60, Utah 59
article.story: SALT LAKE CITY (AP) -- Richard Roby scored 22 points, and teammate Jermyl Jackson-Wilson made a free throw with 2.1 seconds remaining to lift Colorado to a 60-59 victory over Utah Tuesday night. Jackson-Wilson missed his second of two free throws, and the Utes rebounded and called timeout with 1.8 seconds left. But Lawrence Borhas desperation three-pointer missed badly as time expired. The victory was the first for the Buffaloes (2-2) after back-to-back blowout losses, while the Utes fell to a 0-3 start for the first time since 1970. Johnnie Bryant scored 20 points for the Utes, including 11 in a row to start the second half, and Luke Nevill added 14 points and 10 rebounds. But the Utes committed two crucial turnover in the final minute, with the game tied 59-59. The first came on a bad pass after Utah's Shaun Green drew a charging foul on Roby, and the second came when the Utes lost the ball on a fast break following a blocked shot by Nevill. Borha fouled Jackson-Wilson in the ensuing scramble to set up the winning free throws. Kalvin Bay scored 11 points and Jackson-Wilson added 10 for the Buffaloes, who forced 17 turnovers and held the Utes to 43.6 percent shooting. The Buffs led 26-22 at halftime. The teams combined for 17 turnovers in the first half, and the Utes made 6-of-22 shots. Neither team led by more than six points.
